snippet: Four years ago, hordes of young volunteers helped elect President Obama, but this year’s crop seem more world-weary, buffeted by the bad economy.
abstract: Young volunteers for presidential campaigns are markedly different, and less enthused, than those that helped Pres Obama storm to victory in 2008; many college-age volunteers, more than a little world-weary in tougher economic times, often seem driven more by realism than idealism.
lead_paragraph: Four years ago, hordes of young volunteers helped elect President Obama, but this year’s crop seem more world-weary, buffeted by the bad economy.

headline.seo: For Young Volunteers, Realism Is Trumping Idealism of ‘08
headline.main: Idealism Harder to Find From Young Volunteers
headline.print_headline: Idealism Harder to Find From Young Volunteers
